      • getCurrent

        public static java.util.Locale getCurrent()
        Obtain the current locale for presentation purposes. Do not force to US
        Returns:
        Locale the current locale

      • setLocale

        public static void setLocale​(java.util.Locale _locale)
        Sets the locale for presentation purposes.
        Parameters:
        _locale - The locale can be one of the standard java locales

      • isRTL

        public static boolean isRTL()
        Returns a flag indicating whether or not the current locale displays characters right-to-left.
        Returns:
        true if the current locale displays characters right-to-left, false if they are displayed left-to-right.

      • getNaturalNumber

        public static java.lang.String getNaturalNumber​(java.lang.String numbers)
        Provided a non US locale, provide for the ability to parse the string and and force the numbers from the current locale into numbers that would be expected during text input. Will attempt to convert over as much of the string as possible. If not numeric text is included it will not be touched (with the exception of the comma at the moment) Will do a better job detecting the proper comma placement in the future. (digit before and digit after.

      • getDecimalFormat

        public static java.text.DecimalFormat getDecimalFormat​(java.lang.String format)
        Obtains a Locale.US specific decimal formatter.
        Parameters:
        format - the format
